import Head from 'next/head'; // import Image from 'next/image'; export default function Post() { return (<> Projects | Aceso

Aceso Recovery

2018 - Ongoing

Patients hate home exercise plans, therapists hate building them.

Patient compliance to home exercise programs is a joke to PT's across America. Probably because this so-called exercise plan is a printed comic strip of WikiHow esque pictures, handed to you on your way out the door.

Knowing that HEP compliant patients recover much faster and more effectively than their counterparts, we took inspiration from Peloton (and a sprinkle of Jillian Michaels) and created the slickest home exercise plan ever seen. The 3 Click HEP.

Over the summer of 2020 with the help of a panel of surgeons, physical therapists, and personal trainers, we recorded ~300 exercises commonly prescribed in HEPs, following a trio of fitness trainers.

We set out with a goal to:

  1. Help patients follow their HEP
  2. Allow PTs to spend less time making plans
  3. Turn every patient into a success story (and tell people about it too)

Our goals have been manifested in these ways:

  1. Passwordless sign in for patients
  2. Video playlist builder, with:
    • Easy templating
    • Copy/paste functions
    • Custom video uploading per practice
  3. Onboard patients in under 60 seconds

We are still engaging with our customers on the ground floor, knocking on doors and setting appointments.

{/*

The Problems

1. Athletes don't return to sport post-op.

When sport related injuries (like an ACL tear) require surgery, athletes usually never regain full range of motion or strength.

2. Surgeon's take the blame for poor outcomes.

From a surgeon's perspective, the process is well documented and tested. By working closely with one of the Tennessee Valley's largest orthopaedic surgery centers for 2 years, we've learned the problem is almost always in the recovery process, rather than surgery itself.

Patients are instructed to meet with a physical therapist at least weekly (sometimes up to 3x a week), in addition to following a daily Home Exercise Plan (HEP).

*/}
) }
